private_information: I can manipulate blocks with one arm and I observe part of the table.
I follow standard BlocksWorld rules: only the top block of a stack can be moved and I can carry only one block at a time.
robot1.goal: Contribute to moving blocks according to the shared action sequence and report executed actions and local observations.

private_information: I can manipulate blocks with one arm and I observe another part of the table.
I follow standard BlocksWorld rules: only the top block of a stack can be moved and I can carry only one block at a time.
robot2.goal: Contribute to moving blocks according to the shared action sequence and report executed actions and local observations.

private_information: I integrate plans and observations from the robots and generate a final formal problem for a planner.
orchestrator.goal: Take the robots' action reports and produce a PDDL domain and problem suitable for the FastDownwards solver that captures the final state of the blocks.

public_information: There are eight labelled blocks: A B C D E F G H.
Standard BlocksWorld rules apply: only the top block of a stack can be moved and only one block can be carried at a time.
Initial stacks are: A on table with C on A and E on C, and F on table with B on F, H on B, G on H, and D on G.
The agents execute a fixed sequence of 20 actions comprising unstack, stack, pickup and putdown operations.
Final arrangement derived from executing the given actions is: A on the table, C on A, E on C, D on E, G on D, H on G, B on the table, F on B.

plan.system_prompt: You are a robotic manipulator agent that executes and reports block moves. Describe which actions you perform and what you observe after each action. Do not output PDDL.
plan.prompt: Your name is robot1. You have the following public information: {environment->public_information} You have the following private knowledge: {agents->robot1->private_information} Your role is to execute a subset of the shared action sequence and report each executed action and the resulting local state of stacks. Provide clear action reports and observations that the orchestrator can use to assemble the final state.

plan.system_prompt: You are a robotic manipulator agent that executes and reports block moves. Describe which actions you perform and what you observe after each action. Do not output PDDL.
plan.prompt: Your name is robot2. You have the following public information: {environment->public_information} You have the following private knowledge: {agents->robot2->private_information} Your role is to execute a subset of the shared action sequence and report each executed action and the resulting local state of stacks. Provide clear action reports and observations that the orchestrator can use to assemble the final state.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert orchestrator that consumes the agents' action reports and produces a complete PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file targeting the FastDownwards planner. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Ensure the PDDL uses a standard STRIPS-style BlocksWorld encoding and that the final state reflects the integrated actions.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. Use the public information {environment->public_information} the agents' goals {agents->orchestrator->goal} and the plans and observations provided by the agents: {plan_robot1} {plan_robot2} Integrate the reports, resolve any naming or observation differences, and produce a PDDL domain and problem suitable for FastDownwards. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> and the problem between <problem></problem> and ensure the problem's goal describes the final arrangement of blocks.
